intro: Salpingolobivia andalgalensis, commonly known as the Andalusian pipe-vine, is a unique plant species native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and milky sap-producing plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that resemble small pipes, often in shades of purple and pink. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
